qa_pairs.question: What is the policyholder's minimum requirement of work hours per week according to Unum Policy 5355035?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1), the policyholder must perform at least 20 hours of work per week, excluding overtime, to be eligible for disability benefits.

qa_pairs.question: Is there a provision for part-time workers in this policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (4), if a policyholder's regular employment is part-time and they work less than the standard full-time hours, their earnings are still calculated based on their full-time weekly wage.

qa_pairs.question: What percentage of a policyholder's pre-disability earnings is considered for disability benefits calculation?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (12), the total disability benefits are calculated based on 60% of their policyholder's obligations under the policy. This policyholder's group long-term disability insurance companies to pay claims that the unable insolvent company cannot meet.

qa_pairs.question: What is the policyholder's minimum requirement of work hours per week according to Unum Policy 5355035?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1), the policyholder must perform at least 20 hours of work per week, excluding overtime, to be eligible for disability benefits.

qa_pairs.question: Is there a provision for part-time workers in this policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (4), if a policyholder's regular employment is part-time and they work less than the standard full-time hours, their earnings are still calculated based on their full-time weekly wage.

qa_pairs.question: What percentage of a policyholder's pre-disability earnings is considered for disability benefits calculation?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (12), the total disability benefits are calculated based on 60% of their policyholder's obligations under the policy. This policyholder's group long-term disability insurance companies to pay claims that the unable insolvent company cannot meet.

qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1), the policyholder must perform at least 20 hours of work per week, excluding overtime, to be eligible for disability benefits.

qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (4), if a policyholder's regular employment is part-time and they work less than the standard full-time hours, their earnings are still calculated based on their full-time weekly wage.

qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (12), the total disability benefits are calculated based on 60% of their policyholder's obligations under the policy. This policyholder's group long-term disability insurance companies to pay claims that the unable insolvent company cannot meet.

State.selected_text: should know that the insurance companies licensed in this state to write these types of
State.content: Residents of Pennsylvania who purchase life insurance, annuities or health insurance should know that the insurance companies licensed in this state to write these types of insurance are members of the Pennsylvania Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association (PLHIGA).  The purpose of this Association is to assure that policyholders will be protected, within limits, in the unlikely event that a member insurer becomes financially unable to meet its obligations.  If this should happen, the Association will assess its other member insurance companies for the money to pay the claims of insured persons who live in Pennsylvania and, in some cases, to keep coverage in force.  The valuable extra protection provided by these insurers through the Association is limited, however, as noted below, this protection is not a substitute for consumers' care in selecting companies that are well managed and financially stable.  Insurance companies and their agents are prohibited by law from using the existence of the association to induce you to purchase any kind of insurance policy.

qa_pairs.question: Are you required to have a 20% or more loss in indexed monthly earnings during the elimination period to be considered disabled according to Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf?

Elimination Period.selected_text: claim and you will not have to complete another elimination period if:
Elimination Period.content: If you have a  recurrent disability , Unum will treat your disability as part of your prior claim and you will not have to complete another elimination period if: -  you were continuously insured under the plan for the period between the end of your prior claim and your recurrent disability; and -  your recurrent disability occurs within 6 months from the end of your prior claim. Your recurrent disability will be subject to the same terms of the plan as your prior claim and will be treated as a continuation of that disability. Any disability which occurs after 6 months from the date your prior claim ended will be treated as a new claim.  The new claim will be subject to all of the policy provisions, including the elimination period. If you become entitled to payments under any other group long term disability plan, you will not be eligible for payments under the Unum plan.

Monthly Earnings.selected_text: "Monthly Earnings" means your average gross monthly income as figured:
Monthly Earnings.content: "Monthly Earnings" means your average gross monthly income as figured: a.  from the income box on your W-2 form which reflects wages, tips and other compensation received from your Employer for the calendar year just prior to your date of disability; or b.  for the period of your employment with your Employer if you did not receive a W- 2 form prior to your date of disability. Average gross monthly income is your total income before taxes.  It is prior to any deductions made for pre-tax contributions to a qualified deferred compensation plan, Section 125 plan, or flexible spending account.  It does not include income received from car, housing or moving allowances, Employer contributions to a qualified deferred compensation plan, or income received from sources other than your Employer.

Monthly Earnings.selected_text: indexed monthly earnings, due to the same sickness or injury, Unum will figure your
Monthly Earnings.content: If you are disabled and your monthly disability earnings are 20% or more of your indexed monthly earnings, due to the same sickness or injury, Unum will figure your payment as follows: During the first 12 months of payments, while working, your monthly payment will not be reduced as long as disability earnings plus the gross disability payment does not exceed 100% of indexed monthly earnings. 1.  Add your monthly disability earnings to your gross disability payment. 2.  Compare the answer in Item 1 to your indexed monthly earnings. If the answer from Item 1 is less than or equal to 100% of your indexed monthly earnings, Unum will not further reduce your monthly payment. If the answer from Item 1 is more than 100% of your indexed monthly earnings, Unum will subtract the amount over 100% from your monthly payment. After 12 months of payments, while working, you will receive payments based on the percentage of income you are losing due to your disability. 1.  Subtract your disability earnings from your indexed monthly earnings. 2.  Divide the answer in Item 1 by your indexed monthly earnings.  This is your percentage of lost earnings. 3.  Multiply your monthly payment by the answer in Item 2. This is the amount Unum will pay you each month. During the first 24 months of disability payments, if your monthly disability earnings exceed 80% of your indexed monthly earnings, Unum will stop sending you payments and your claim will end. Beyond 24 months of disability payments, if your monthly disability earnings exceed the gross disability payment, Unum will stop sending you payments and your claim will end.

Indexing is only used as a factor in the determination of the percentage of lost earnings while you are disabled and working.

qa_pairs.question: How can one access this Work Life Assistance Program?

qa_pairs.question: In what situations is the Work Life Assistance Program helpful?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page [6, 32], the program is designed to assist with a wide range of personal or professional issues, including everyday problems as well as crisis support. Examples given are help in finding day care, transportation for an elderly parent, researching colleges for a child, and dealing with workplace stress.

Work Life Assistance Program.selected_text: IS THERE A WORK LIFE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AVAILABLE WITH THE PLAN?
Work Life Assistance Program.content: IS THERE A WORK LIFE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AVAILABLE WITH THE PLAN? We do provide you and your dependents access to a work life assistance program designed to assist you with problems of daily living. You can call and request assistance for virtually any personal or professional issue, from helping find a day care or transportation for an elderly parent, to researching possible colleges for a child, to helping to deal with the stress of the workplace.  This work life program is available for everyday issues as well as crisis support. This service is also available to your Employer. This program can be accessed by a 1-800 telephone number available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week or online through a website. Information about this program can be obtained through your plan administrator.

Waiver of Premium.content: WAIVER OF PREMIUM Unum does not require premium payments for an insured while he or she is receiving Long Term Disability payments under this plan.

qa_pairs.question: Who is exempted from making premium payments under this Unum policy while receiving Long Term Disability payments?
qa_pairs.answer: The insured individual is not required to make premium payments.

qa_pairs.question: Under what conditions can an insured stop making premium payments under this plan?
qa_pairs.answer: An insured will not have to make premium payments while he or she is receiving Long Term Disability payments under this plan.

qa_pairs.question: How are the waiver of premium and Long Term Disability payments related in this Unum policy?
qa_pairs.answer: The waiver of premium applies when an insured is receiving Long Term Disability payments under this policy, meaning they do not have to make premium payments during that time.

qa_pairs.answer: It will be applied only if the disability begins in the first 12 months after the insured's effective date of coverage for the applicable benefit, or such shorter time as provided in the policy.

Contribution.content: -  the date the policy or a plan is cancelled; -  the date you no longer are in an eligible group; -  the date your eligible group is no longer covered; -  the last day of the period for which you made any required contributions; or -  the last day you are in active employment except as provided under the covered layoff or leave of absence provision. Unum will provide coverage for a payable claim which occurs while you are covered under the policy or plan.

qa_pairs.question: What are the dates that Unum will provide coverage for a payable claim?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 19, Unum will provide coverage for a payable claim which occurs while you are covered under the policy or plan.

qa_pairs.question: How is average gross monthly income calculated?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 15 and 19, average gross monthly income is your total income before taxes. It does not include income received from car, housing or moving allowances, Employer contributions to a qualified deferred compensation plan, or income received from sources other than your Employer.

qa_pairs.question: What are retirement payments and how will they be considered by Unum?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 22 and 37, Retirement payments include those benefits which are based on your Employer's contribution to the retirement plan. Disability benefits which reduce the retirement benefit under the plan will also be considered as a retirement benefit. Regardless of how retirement funds from the retirement plan are distributed, Unum will consider your and your Employer's contributions to be distributed simultaneously throughout your lifetime. Amounts received do not include amounts rolled over or transferred to any eligible retirement plan. Unum will use the definition of eligible retirement plan as defined in Section 402 of the Internal Revenue Code including any future amendments which affect the definition.

Contribution.content: Average gross monthly income is your total income before taxes. qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 15 and 19, average gross monthly income is your total income before taxes. It does not include income received from car, housing or moving allowances, Employer contributions to a qualified deferred compensation plan, or income received from sources other than your Employer.

qa_pairs.question: What are retirement payments and how will they be considered by Unum?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 22 and 37, Retirement payments include those benefits which are based on your Employer's contribution to the retirement plan. Disability benefits which reduce the retirement benefit under the plan will also be considered as a retirement benefit. Regardless of how retirement funds from the retirement plan are distributed, Unum will consider your and your Employer's contributions to be distributed simultaneously throughout your lifetime. Amounts received do not include amounts rolled over or transferred to any eligible retirement plan. Unum will use the definition of eligible retirement plan as defined in Section 402 of the Internal Revenue Code including any future amendments which affect the definition.

Mental Illness Limitation.selected_text: Unum will not apply the mental illness limitation to dementia if it is a result of:
Mental Illness Limitation.content: Unum will not apply the mental illness limitation to dementia if it is a result of: -  stroke; -  trauma; -  viral infection; -  Alzheimer's disease; or -  other conditions not listed which are not usually treated by a mental health provider or other qualified provider using psychotherapy, psychotropic drugs, or other similar methods of treatment.

qa_pairs.question: What mental illness limitation exemptions does Unum provide for dementia?
qa_pairs.answer: Unum will not apply the mental illness limitation to dementia if it is a result of stroke, trauma, viral infection, Alzheimer's disease, or other conditions not listed which are not usually treated by a mental health provider or other qualified provider using psychotherapy, psychotropic drugs, or other similar methods of treatment.

qa_pairs.question: Which specific conditions mentioned in the policy are not typically treated by a mental health provider?
qa_pairs.answer: Other conditions not listed which are not usually treated by a mental health provider or other qualified provider using psychotherapy, psychotropic drugs, or other similar methods of treatment.

qa_pairs.question: If dementia is caused by a viral infection, what is the policy's stance on applying the mental illness limitation?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page [26], if dementia is caused by a viral infection, the mental illness limitation will not be applied.

Carrier.selected_text: CHANGES INSURANCE CARRIERS TO UNUM? (Continuity of Coverage)
Carrier.content: WHAT IF YOU ARE NOT IN ACTIVE EMPLOYMENT WHEN YOUR EMPLOYER CHANGES INSURANCE CARRIERS TO UNUM? (Continuity of Coverage)

qa_pairs.question: What happens to a payment if you are not in active employment when your employer changes insurance carriers to Unum, under the Continuity of Coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 28, your payment will be limited to the amount that would have been paid by the prior carrier. Unum will reduce your payment by any amount for which your prior carrier is liable.

qa_pairs.question: What are the conditions under which Unum may send a payment if you have a disability due to a pre-existing condition when your employer changes insurance carriers to Unum?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 29, Unum may send a payment if your disability results from a pre-existing condition if either the Unum plan or the prior carrier's plan, if benefits would have been paid had that policy remained in force, is satisfied. If neither is satisfied, Unum will not make any payments.

qa_pairs.question: What changes have been made to the provision for disability due to a pre-existing condition when your employer changes insurance carriers to Unum, regarding credit for the pre-existing condition period?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf page 41, the provision in the Benefit Information section of the policy has been amended to provide that Unum will credit the pre-existing condition period you satisfied under another similar group disability policy if you were covered under the prior policy within 30 days of being effective under this policy and you applied for this coverage when you first became eligible.

Worksite Modification.selected_text: A worksite modification might be what is needed to allow you to perform the material
Worksite Modification.content: A worksite modification might be what is needed to allow you to perform the material and substantial duties of your regular occupation with your Employer.  One of our designated professionals will assist you and your Employer to identify a modification we agree is likely to help you remain at work or return to work.  This agreement will be in writing and must be signed by you, your Employer and Unum. When this occurs, Unum will reimburse your Employer for the cost of the

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of a worksite modification as described in Unum Policy 5355035 (1).pdf?
qa_pairs.answer: A worksite modification might be what is needed to allow you to perform the material and substantial duties of your regular occupation with your Employer.

qa_pairs.question: Who assists in identifying a suitable worksite modification that Unum agrees will help an employee return or remain at work, according to the policy?
qa_pairs.answer: One of our designated professionals will assist you and your Employer to identify a modification we agree is likely to help you remain at work or return to work.

qa_pairs.question: What are the conditions for Unum to reimburse an employer for the cost of a worksite modification, as per the policy?
qa_pairs.answer: When this occurs (i.e., when there's an agreement on a worksite modification), Unum will reimburse your Employer for the cost of the modification. This agreement must be in writing and signed by you, your Employer, and Unum.
